body_html:
When trying to load a frozen pb model to visualise its graph, the snippets above didn't work for me in tensorflow 1.4, Python 3.6 (the resulting folder was empty).

Using the Upload - Choose file option in tensorboard's GUI gave Graph visualization failed: The graph is empty.

However, using the import_to_tensorboard function did the trick:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/python/tools/import_pb_to_tensorboard.py
body_text:
When trying to load a frozen pb model to visualise its graph, the snippets above didn't work for me in tensorflow 1.4, Python 3.6 (the resulting folder was empty).
Using the Upload - Choose file option in tensorboard's GUI gave Graph visualization failed: The graph is empty.
However, using the import_to_tensorboard function did the trick:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/python/tools/import_pb_to_tensorboard.py
body:
When trying to load a frozen pb model to visualise its graph, the snippets above didn't work for me in tensorflow 1.4, Python 3.6 (the resulting folder was empty).

Using the Upload - Choose file option in tensorboard's GUI gave `Graph visualization failed: The graph is empty`.

However, using the `import_to_tensorboard` function did the trick:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/python/tools/import_pb_to_tensorboard.py
